unicef-ecd1-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.def: Attendance in early childhood education – Percentage of children 36–59 months old who are attending an early childhood education programme.
unicef-ecd1-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.name: Attendance in early childhood education
unicef-ecd1-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.source: Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS), Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS), and other national surveys. Last update: June 2021.

unicef-ecd10-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.def: Percentage of children 36–59 months old with whom an adult has engaged in four or more of the following activities to promote learning and school readiness in the past three days: a) reading books to the child, b) telling stories to the child, c) singing songs to the child, d) taking the child outside the home, e) playing with the child, and f) spending time with the child naming, counting or drawing things.
unicef-ecd10-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.name: Early stimulation and responsive care by adults
unicef-ecd10-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.source: DHS, MICS and other national surveys. Last update: June 2021.

unicef-ecd11-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.def: Percentage of children 36–59 months old whose father has engaged in four or more of the following activities to promote learning and school readiness in the past three days: a) reading books to the child, b) telling stories to the child, c) singing songs to the child, d) taking the child outside the home, e) playing with the child, and f) spending time with the child naming, counting or drawing things.
unicef-ecd11-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.name: Early stimulation and responsive care by father
unicef-ecd11-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.source: DHS, MICS and other national surveys. Last update: June 2021.

unicef-ecd12-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.def: Percentage of children 0–59 months old who have three or more children’s books at home.
unicef-ecd12-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.name: Learning materials at home, Children's books
unicef-ecd12-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.source: DHS, MICS and other national surveys. Last update: June 2021.

unicef-ecd13-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.def: Percentage of children 0–59 months old who have three or more children’s books at home.
unicef-ecd13-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.name: Learning materials at home, Children's books
unicef-ecd13-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.source: DHS, MICS and other national surveys. Last update: June 2021.

unicef-ecd14-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.def: Percentage of children 0–59 months old who have three or more children’s books at home.

unicef-ecd15-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.def: Percentage of children 0–59 months old with two or more of the following playthings at home: household objects or objects found outside (sticks, rocks, animals, shells, leaves etc.), homemade toys or toys that came from a store.
unicef-ecd15-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.name: Learning materials at home, Playthings
unicef-ecd15-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.source: DHS, MICS and other national surveys. Last update: June 2021.

unicef-ecd18-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.def: Percentage of children 0–59 months old left alone or in the care of another child younger than 10 years of age for more than one hour at least once in the past week.
unicef-ecd18-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.name: Children with inadequate supervision
unicef-ecd18-earlyChildhoodDevelompent.source: DHS, MICS and other national surveys. Last update: June 2021.
